wikipedia_page.main: Abraham Cohen (1887, Reading, Berkshire – 1957) was a Jewish-British scholar. He was the editor of the Soncino Books of the Bible and also participated in the Soncino translation of the Talmud and Midrash. He attended the University of London and Cambridge and was a minister of Birmingham Hebrew Congregation from 1933. He also participated  actively in the World Jewish Congress and the Zionist movement.
